snippet: Most Democratic lawmakers stayed away from the State House floor in a continuing battle over union representation at private businesses in the state.
abstract: Democrats in Indiana's state legislature stay away from House floor on first day of lawmaking session in order to prevent Republicans from passing 'right to work' legislation; law would prohibit union contracts at private sector workplaces from requiring workers to pay dues or other fees to a union.
lead_paragraph: Most Democratic lawmakers stayed away from the State House floor in a continuing battle over union representation at private businesses in the state.

headline.main: ‘Right to Work’ Republicans Deprived of a Quorum in Indiana
headline.print_headline: ‘Right to Work’ Republicans Deprived of a Quorum in Indiana
